intro: Lasiocephalus mochensis, commonly known as the Moché lasiocephalus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that appear in late summer. Its leaves are typically broad and have a rough, textured surface, which helps it retain moisture in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
